title: opt out of chat
body:
Why is this not an option? It would be a quality of life improvement for both the players and the game community. Very rarely will a person say something of a constructive nature, from the early 'GG's' to the constant flaming? Further, if one response to this negative behaviour, they can be punished equally, or in some cases, more severely than the person who is ultimately responsible. 

 Why not implement an option that can prevent this toxicity, without having to mute every person? Additionally, why can't one mute champ select, or better yet, permanently disable chat in all its forms.

replies.body:
I'm sad this topic got derailed because of some poor use of analogies. Lets use two different arguments instead.

1. My child loves this game but frequently comes to me and notes how terrible the comments that are said to him/her are. I would like the option of allowing him/her to play without exposing them to something that can only be retroactively punished/diminished.

2. I've played thousands of games, watched hundreds of hours of streamers playing, and generally understand the meta through watching the professional scene. I'm going to take a wild guess and say that something in the neighborhood of .5% of typed messages are beneficial to the team or the game. It's almost always memes, insults, or someones bored rambling about things that have nothing to do with the game.

It is extremely hard to understand that given the rate of combative, unhelpful, and abusive behavior that occurs in typed chat that this game could even possible be rated 13+ if it doesn't have a chat opt out function.

 If one can go in before the game starts and mute each individual player reliably every game all the time and not be punished for it, then why deny people the option to do so in a single click? All I've seen from the green colored named person is "personal responsibility". I think that's what this thread is asking for. 

Allow me to be personally responsible AND efficient by clicking one time for good instead of 9 times per game.

before being banned. ive asked to have my chat restricted by choice and not allow me to use this function. the answer i got was it wont show if ive improved if the chat is not there to distinguish whether ive improved or not.  however they never try to help me improve just constant punishments but that is another story.

Banning your chat permanently doesn't solve the problem, it only pushes your outlet to somewhere else that is likely also harmful to other players (trolling, griefing, afking etc).

You *yourself* need to find a healthy outlet for your frustration, rather than abusing random internet strangers and saying "I can't help it and noone will help me". It's your behaviour, and therefore your responsibility. Outsiders can only help you if you are *really* willing to be helped.

Try yelling at your screen instead of typing, isn't practical in all situations but it might work for you. If that doesn't work try moving your chat off screen, or if you have a keyboard you can rebind (razer or some such) then unbind your enter key while you are in game.

If you can't do either of those then maybe try to look a bit deeper into why you get frustrated and get some perspective. Is it because someone isn't doing what you tell them? Do you do what random strangers tell you when it doesn't make sense to you or is something they could do themselves just as easily? Probably not. 

Is it because your score is better than everyone else's but they won't follow you? KDA isn't everything and they know that, so if you want them to follow your lead, you have to give them a better reason than "I have a good score".

Is it because you're having a bad game and you know you should be better but it feels like you can't catch a break? Take a break from the game (after you finish it of course), since clearly you aren't in the best space to be playing League. As for in the game itself, take a deep breath, back up and play it real safe until you can either catch up or help your team to pull something off. You don't have to carry to win, ideally you just have to not feed.

Is it because someone on your team is toxic? What do you think being toxic back accomplishes? You might think it's closure or revenge, but really it's just fuel for their fire and stopping to their level. You don't stop toxicity by becoming part of the problem. Take a breath, and mute them. If you report them after game then they'll get their punishment in the form of a ban, which is far more effective than anything a random stranger (you) can yell at them. It's just not worth it.

Great points
What about if the player has played for years, never been punished but never uses chat or sees the point to it, all it does is interver could they get it removed?

Even if you don't use it, it's still a means for your team to communicate with you.

When considering punishments you are judged on your behaviour alone. It doesn't matter who started it. Like I said, you don't help to get rid of toxicity by becoming part of the problem, it's rather counter-intuitive don't you think?

Someone being a complete douchecanoe does not give you a pass to say things like "I would happily watch you choke to death, film it and upload it to liveleak". Nothing gives you a free pass to say shit like that, especially in a *13+* rated game.

Could be they were banned between someone else reporting and you doing it so that someone else got it instead.

Your responsible for your own actions. If some is trolling it's annoying as shit but it doesn't give the right to abuse them. Christ half the time that's what they want. Not to mention but if someone is having a bad game the easiest way to get them to start trolling is flame them.

I'm not quite sure why you're having such difficulty grasping what Gloric is trying to get at here, Mozzie. It's like you're deliberately clinging on to an awkward analogy in order to obfuscate his point.

So let's try a nice simple one:

* A person has a needle, a little sharp needle and they intend to poke you with it. So away they go, _poke poke poke_

* "OUCH!" you say. "That hurts stop that please." But they don't stop, they keep poking you, _poke poke poke_, on and on. It hurts. The needle is sharp. But you can't get up and leave. And it keeps on hurting.

* Until you can't take any more, you lash out, grab their hand with the needle and twist it with enough force that they drop the needle.

BAM! Under Riot's interpretation you are now both equally ripe for punishment.

What Gloric is trying to get across is that this seems both unreasonable and unfair. It doesn't gel with the norms of society and it's the flaws within Riot's reporting and behaviour detection system that allow this egregious form of punishment to continue.

For the most part I agree with Gloric, at least in the sense that the system right now has some pretty serious flaws. I also agree with the OP's sentiment that chat is rife with abuse and should be addressed by Riot in the near future so they can look to make some positive changes.

These changes can be accomplished in various ways:

1. The reporting/punishment system could be refined
i. more human reviews
ii. clearer definition between aggressors (ie. trolls) and other people deemed abusive by using different punishment forms (warning, chat restrict, suspension) and singling out the harshest penalties for the most aggressive and abusive players
iii. ?

1. The chat system could be refined
i. allow for an opt out (OP's idea) or better yet have chat disabled with an opt in approach
ii. use word filters for common abusive, harassing terms
iii. make chat limited to predetermined statements (eg. "lets go top/mid/bot/baron/drag")
iv. ?

1. The smart pings system could be refined

1. Some other form of communication could be introduced (eg. in game comms)

Anyway, that's my two cents.
And they would instantly be banned for doing so, wasting almost no time whatsoever. There is no "spam" if they are banned for false reports within 1-3 attempts.

Self defence does not cover retaliation. If someone attacks you and you fend them off that's self defense. 

If someone attacks you, you fend them off and then keep attacking them that's retaliation and is a crime. Once your actions are no longer about the defense of your person it's considered a crime. And I used the one punch laws as an example. Because the entire point of them was to put harsher penalties in place for where serious bodily harm wasn't intended but occurred. I freely admit there are instances where someone could react like that and not get charged. Battered spouse laws for example but those are the exceptions rather than the rule.

If you think being trolled or griefed in a video games is the same thing as being sexually violated I do not have the words to express how wrong you are
Say what you want. That's how I feel when a troll or griefer ruins my games over and over and over.

It shouldn't even be about _"opting out"_ it should be about _"opting in"_ to chat.

Riot doesn't seem to understand how the game develops to the novice. Right from the get go chat is there, like it's somehow a useful feature for gameplay to happen. This normalises something that at best is an addon and at worst is completely redundant. It's not essential to teamplay, taking obectives, winning games etc. Just like all chat is opt in, chat in general should be an optional feature, that way it's not normalised and considered an ingrained aspect of the game.

You should learn to use pings effectively and even - if Riot were to listen to suggestions by myself and countless others over the years - have a basic communication system introduced allowing you to say things like _"shove [top/mid/bot]"_, _"go [dragon/baron/inhib]"_ etc. Communication that directly impacts the game on a tactical level should be the norm, along with learning mechanics, basic strategies and teamplay. Then, and only then, if you get to level 30 you can opt in to a silly chat where you can crack racist jokes, make threats and spam troll messages to your fellow summoners.
